definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: The Yuanxiang (Distant Fragrance) Hall at the center of the garden is the largest hall type architecture of the entire garden.
sentences.chinese: 园区中心的远香堂是全园最大的厅堂式建筑。

sentences.english: Spaghetti with kaffir be placed in rooms directly to the air-conditioned living room.
sentences.chinese: 大盆君子兰可放置在厅堂，直接用来调节客厅的空气。

sentences.english: Through the window of the hall , we could see the big park of the upper belvedere.
sentences.chinese: 透过厅堂里的窗户，可以看到上宫大公园的全景。

sentences.english: Flowers adorn the table adn interesting people adorn the hall.
sentences.chinese: 鲜花扮靓桌子，有趣的人扮靓厅堂。

sentences.english: Hardly had he left the room when the traveller entered.
sentences.chinese: 他刚走出厅堂门，那客人就进来了。

sentences.english: Come to the humble hall in which we meet.
sentences.chinese: 到我们聚会的那个粗陋的厅堂里去。

sentences.english: Show reduced scale model can accurate reflection actual hall acoustic field over loud time.
sentences.chinese: 表示缩尺模型可以准确的反映实际厅堂声场馀响时间。

sentences.english: The chivalric cafeteria decorate inside hotel is very coarse, put in hall hall have armature.
sentences.chinese: 旅馆内的骑士餐馆装潢极为粗糙，厅堂里放有盔甲。

sentences.english: The man left the room, and returned almost immediately, accompanied by three others.
sentences.chinese: 工人便走出厅堂，立即又领着三个人转回来。

sentences.english: Under the world eave and among Chinese halls.
sentences.chinese: 在世界的屋檐下，在中国的厅堂间。

sentences.english: Along the axis of three-hall building.

definition: reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
central room of a traditional Chinese house
main hall of a Buddhist temple
main hall of a Buddhist temple
warm room/warm partition of a room
